text:
Hi there. I'm Jennifer from English with 
Jennifer. I'd like to give you a short quiz

about Christmas traditions here in 
the U.S. Let's see what you know.
What are these?

Christmas stockings. They look like big 
socks. Right? That's where the tradition

came from. In modern times, we have these 
oversized socks, and we decorate them.

They don't go on our feet, though. Christmas 
stockings hold special treats. My kids usually

find chocolates and other small gifts in their 
stockings on Christmas morning, December 25th.
Where are stockings typically hung?
On the mantel of the fireplace. See the shelf?

These are stocking holders. They're weighted down 
so that the heavy stocking full of gifts doesn't

fall to the floor. In our old home, we didn't 
have a fireplace, so we had to be creative.

We tied our stockings to the railing of the 
stairs. Santa also has to be creative with

his entry and exit. How does he usually get 
into houses to deliver gifts? Do you know?

Through the chimney. But if there isn't a 
chimney, I heard that he has the help of a

little elf who goes through the keyhole and 
then lets Santa in through the front door.
Santa Claus has a lot to do on Christmas Eve,

so how do children help him get 
through the night and the long journey?

They leave out a plate of cookies and a glass of 
milk. Do any of these traditions sound familiar

or do they sound very strange? You can let me know 
in the comments. We'll end here. Please like the

video if you found it interesting and useful. As 
always, thanks for watching and happy studies!

Everyone, visit me on Patreon! You can join to support
my online work, get live lessons and bonus videos,
and some of you may even want a monthly 1:1 video call.

Follow me on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
Why not join me on Patreon?
And don't forget to subscribe on YouTube.
